question: A 13-year-old female presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with on and off menorrhagia, bleeding gums, and petechial rashes. Her laboratory reports show the following results; Hb= 12.5 g/dl, platelet count= 350,000/mm3, activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)= 49s (normal: 29-40s). Which of the following could be the likely diagnosis?
An old woman comes to the outpatient department and is diagnosed with iron deficiency anemia. Which of the following cells will be seen on her blood smear?
Inflammation is a process regulated by several mediators. Which of the following is a negative regulator of inflammation?
Which of the following is responsible for iron absorption from the intestine?
Where in the cell are oxygen free radicals formed?
Which of the following conditions is seen in megaloblastic anemia?
B and T cells that recognize self-antigens during their development in the lymphoid organs are destroyed at an early stage. What is this process called?
Which of the following is an autoimmune disease?
Which of the following is responsible for the tensile strength of a wound during healing?

answers.option: Structural collagen modifications and collagen cross linking
Structural collagen modification and thinning of collagen fibers

question: A patient is given oral iron supplements. Which of the following in the diet would increase iron absorption in the gut?
Which of the following statement is correct regarding folic acid and vitamin B12?

answers.option: Vitamin B12 is essential for the formation of the active form of folic acid
Vitamin B12 alone takes part in DNA synthesis
Folic acid is essential for the formation of the active form of vitamin B12
Vitamin B12 plays a role in purine synthesis
Folic acid plays a role in pyrimidine synthesis

question: A patient comes into the outpatient department with signs and symptoms of anemia. Blood smear analysis shows microcytic anemia. Which type of microcytic anemia is associated with reduced ferritin levels?

Which of the following types of necrosis is seen in a granulomatous infection by Mycobacterium tuberculosis?
Which of the following chemical mediators cause vasodilation in acute inflammation?
Which of the following mediator plays no role in leukocyte recruitment to the blood vessels?

answers.option: All of these play a role in leukocyte recruitment

question: Which of these is not included in acute inflammation events?
Which of the following conditions would give rise to hypersegmented leukocytes seen on microscopic examination?
Which of the following is incorrect about central tolerance?

answers.option: Immature T-cell recognizes self antigens and undergo apoptosis
Self-antigens can be expressed on thymus epithelial cells
Central tolerance occurs only in thymus
Ensures that mature T-cells don't recognize self-antigens
Lack of central tolerance can result in autoimmune disorders

question: Which of the following is the best diagnostic test for thalassemia?

answers.option: Dysplasia of epithelium with the invasion of basement membrane
Dysplasia of epithelium without the invasion of basement membrane

question: A woman presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with bleeding gums, epistaxis, and non-palpable rashes. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old girl comes to the outpatient department with a complete blood count (CBC) report that shows RBC count to be 5.5 million/μl, Hb=11.5 g/dL, MCV=60 fL, and normal red cell distribution width (RDW). What test should be done next?

answers.option: Reassure the patient and order no further test

question: Interleukin-5 (IL-5) is required for the activation of which of the following cells?

In sickle cell anemia, which type of hemoglobin is most useful?

Where does red infarct usually occur in?
A patient with liver cirrhosis comes with abdominal distention (ascites). Ascites is due to the low level of protein in the plasma. Which of the following proteins could be low?

Which of the following is the characteristic of a benign tumor?
Which of the following is a characteristic of malignant tumors?

answers.option: Help in the formation of superoxide

question: What does a deficiency of factor VIII cause?
Epstein-Barr virus causes which type of malignancy in African children?
What combination of blood groups leads to erythroblastosis fetalis?

answers.option: When the mother is O+ and fetus is O-
When the mother is AB+ and fetus is AB-
When the mother is Rh- and fetus is Rh+
When the mother is B+ and fetus is O+
When the mother is A+ and fetus is B-

question: Hemolytic disease of newborn due to Rh incompatibility is caused by which type of hypersensitivity?
How does histamine cause increased vascular leakage?

answers.option: Increased margination of leukocytes at the site of injury

question: Human T-cell leukemia virus type-1 (HTLV-1) affects which inflammatory cells?

answers.option: More than 10 mitoses/10 high power fields
Altered nuclear cytoplasmic ratio of cancer cells
Formation of tumors against normal cells
Markedly disturbed orientation of cancer cells

question: How can iron be rapidly depleted from the body?
What condition are macro-ovalocytes in a peripheral blood smear seen in?

What is the movement of leukocytes to the site of an injurious stimulus called?
Which of the following is most likely to lead to a patient presenting with bleeding?
What is the inheritance pattern of sickle cell anemia?
Classic hemophilia is caused by the deficiency of which of the following?
What is the most common cause of iron loss?
Which of the following would be the most useful to test iron deficiency anemia?
Hemolytic disease of the newborn (HDN) can be categorized as which type of hypersensitivity?
Which of the following laboratory studies is the most useful in the diagnosis of iron deficiency anemia?

answers.option: Normal MCV(mean corpuscular volume) and normal MCH (mean corpuscular hemoglobin)
Low MCV (mean corpuscular volume) and low MCH (mean corpuscular hemoglobin)
High MCV(mean corpuscular volume) and high MCH (mean corpuscular hemoglobin)
Normal MCV (mean corpuscular volume) and low MCH (mean corpuscular hemoglobin)
Normal MCV(mean corpuscular volume) and high MCH (mean corpuscular hemoglobin)

question: A 16-year-old girl comes to the clinic with complaints of recurrent infections and itching. She has a family history of the same problem. The diagnosis relates to a deficiency in innate response. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

By decreasing the levels of which of the following substances does aspirin inhibit platelet aggregation?
Which protein is abundantly present in neoplastic cells?
Which of the following options represents the correct characteristics of red blood cells in the blood smears of a patient suffering from thalassemia?

answers.option: Non-nucleated cells, target cells, and microcytic, hypochromic cells
Nucleated cells, target cells, and microcytic, hyperchromic cells
Non-nucleated cells and normocytic, hypochromic cells
Nucleated cells, target cells, and microcytic, hypochromic cells
Nucleated cells, target cells, and microcytic, normochromic cells

question: A 5-year-old boy comes to the outpatient department complaining of a painful and swollen knee. On examination, bleeding is seen within the knee joint but with no signs of physical trauma. His mother gives a family history of a maternal uncle who recently died of a bleeding disorder. Investigations show isolated increased APTT. What is the most likely diagnosis?

The presence of pus and swelling in the tonsils indicates which of the following conditions?
Porphyria results in the accumulation of a unique pattern of intermediates caused by the deficiency of which of the following?
Regarding carcinogens, which of the following statements is correct?

answers.option: No promotor is required for direct acting chemical carcinogen
All carcinogens are some form of ionic radiation
Most of the known carcinogens are metabolized by cytochrome P-450

question: Which of the following regarding HbH is correct?

answers.option: Not as severe as β-thalassemia major
Caused by the deletion of three α-globin genes

question: A cell can divide a maximum of up to 30-35 times, however, neoplastic cells do not have a limited number of cell divisions. This characteristic of neoplastic cells can be attributed to which of the following factors?

A girl comes to the outpatient department with complaints of epistaxis and small bruising on her skin. While giving her history she informs the physician that her sister has the same problem. Laboratory analysis shows that her partial thromboplastin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) are normal but prolonged bleeding time. What is the likely diagnosis?
Why might cancer stem cells be less susceptible to chemotherapy?

answers.option: Because of distant metastasis of tumor
Growth rate equals that of adjacent normal cells
Cells are mostly in G₀ phase

question: A 15-year-old boy comes to the outpatient department with a prolonged history of hemarthrosis (bleeding and swelling into muscles and joints) and unexplained bleeding from small bruises. Laboratory examination shows prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) as well as prolonged bleeding time. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Raynaud's phenomenon and fibrosis of GI tract, skin, and tissues are symptoms of which of the following?
Reiter's syndrome is a systemic autoimmune disease triggered by infection with intestinal pathogen. Which triad characterizes this disease?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the clinic with the complaint of a swelling in the neck. On examination, his cervical lymph nodes are hard, tough, and immobile. What is the most likely diagnosis on the basis of examination?
What causes sickle cell disease?

answers.option: Decreased synthesis of beta chain of globin
Replacement of valine by a glutamic acid
Point mutation in the 6th codon of the beta globin chain

question: The special propensity to collect in tissues undergoing allergic reactions is demonstrated by which of the following types of WBCs?

answers.option: Activation of RBC to eliminate the offending agent
Accumulation of B-cells at the site of injury
Transmigration of the plasma, and red blood cells

answers.option: Occlusion of the vascular supply of an organ

Bone marrow transplantation at an early stage is the treatment of choice

question: A child is suffering from chronic granulomatous disease. He has a genetic deficiency due to which he is more prone to infections, especially staphylococcal infection. Why is this?

answers.option: Absence of cofactors such as iodine and bromine

question: A middle-aged female with a known case of rheumatoid arthritis consulted her physician during her follow-up visit. A 60-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of burning micturition and fever. On examination, blood pressure is 90/60 mm of Hg, and heart rate is 110 beats/min. answers.option: Host cells and donor complement proteins react
The reaction is due to preformed IgE granules
Donor cells and host complement proteins react

Which statement best describes an adenoma?

answers.option: A malignant epithelial carcinoma of glands
A benign carcinoma of fibrous tissue
A benign epithelial carcinoma of glands

question: A girl is brought to the outpatient department with complaints of gum bleeding, and epistaxis. Her complete blood count (CBC) shows a normal platelet count and prolonged bleeding time. There is a family history of a younger sister with easy bruising. What is the diagnosis?

A patient has been diagnosed with a malignant eye tumor in the upper right eye. His molecular analysis shows deletion of both copies of the tumor suppressor gene that checks the transition from the G1 to S phase of the cell cycle. Which of the following genes is defective?
Atrophy of stomach mucosa damages the parietal cells that secrete intrinsic factor. This causes which one of the following?
Which of the following features of the adaptive immune system produces an exaggerated response?

A middle-aged woman with a history of rheumatoid arthritis consults her doctor. On examination, she is found to have splenomegaly. Her laboratory results reveal neutropenia and anemia. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old patient comes to the clinic with pain in his leg for over a week. He further adds that due to pain, he could not move his leg. He has now developed deep vein thrombosis in his leg. Which of the following factors is most likely responsible for thrombus formation?
A 5-year-old child, who has a history of eczema, develops rhinitis and develops asthma with seasonal change. What is the most likely change seen on the peripheral blood smear?

A middle-aged male comes to the outpatient department with a low to high-grade fever that has been on and off for the last year and has lymphadenopathy. Lymph nodes are discrete, enlarged, non-tender, and have a rubbery consistency. The rest of the examination is unremarkable. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is responsible for anemia due to reduced erythropoiesis?

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room with a history of a knee injury. On physical examination, the knee is found to be painful and swollen. The boy's mother told the physician that one of his maternal uncles died from a bleeding disorder. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient clinic with complaints of frequent nosebleeds and an episode of blood in his stools two months ago. His parents and his elder sister were all healthy. His mother informed the doctor, that one of her brothers was also suffering from the same symptoms. The doctor advised laboratory investigations to evaluate his coagulation profile. The disease he is suffering from has which one of the following etiologies?
A patient was diagnosed with megaloblastic anemia. Why should she be treated with both folic acid and vitamin B12?

answers.option: Vitamin B12 decreases folic acid toxicity
Folic acid alone causes improvement of hematologic symptoms but can cause worsening of neurologic symptoms
Folic acid alone can cause worsening of both hematologic and neurologic symptoms
Folic acid does not work alone unless supplemented with vitamin B12
Folic acid requires vitamin B12 for activation

question: A 55-year-old man was diagnosed with constrictive pericarditis, two years after suffering from trauma to the heart. When he died an autopsy was performed. The heart was encased in a thickened, fibrotic pericardium. The pericardium was attached to the heart by a stingy material that was difficult to remove. What type of inflammation did the patient have in his pericardium?
Which of the following mediators of inflammation cause symptoms of headache, fever, and pain in the sinuses in individuals sick with flu?
A 65-year-old woman is being treated for pain and inflammation in her joints for the past year. Which of the following statements regarding the patient's inflammation is correct?

answers.option: It may result in granulomas composed of epithelial cells and blood vessels
It always follows the acute inflammation
It is predominantly characterized by a neutrophilic infiltrate
It involves co-existence of inflammation, tissue repair and attempts at repair

question: An individual sprains their ankle while hiking in the mountains and it becomes inflamed. Which of the following statements is most correct regarding this type of inflammation?

answers.option: It is characterized by the formation of granulomas
The cellular infiltrate comprises of macrophages and lymphocytes
It is not associated with tissue damage
It is characterized heat, redness, pain and swelling

question: A 20-year-old man presents to the emergency room with complaints of developing a puffy face and difficulty breathing after eating prawns an hour ago. Which of the following inflammatory mediators is most likely responsible for this condition?
Benign and malignant tumors have different behavior patterns. Which of the following properties unequivocally denotes a tumor as being malignant?
Tumors are classified according to their degree of differentiation and can range from undifferentiated to well-differentiated. What is the term for lack of differentiation?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of generalized weakness and shortness of breath on exertion for the past week. On examination she has pallor. Complete blood count showed a Hb of 6.0 g/dL, MCV: 55 fL, MCH: 18 pg, WBCs: 5000, platelets: 400,000. The blood smear shows a hypochromic and microcytic picture. What further investigation would you like to advise?

A 35-year-old man presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of exertion and breathlessness for the past three weeks. He was diagnosed with anemia. Laboratory investigations show normal iron levels. The physician suspects impaired ability of the bone marrow to produce normal red blood cells. What is the hallmark of this condition?

answers.option: Decreased myeloid precursors on bone marrow

question: A 10-year-old boy presents to the pediatric outpatient department with complaints of fever and gum bleeding for the past week. A complete blood count showed pancytopenia and reticulocytopenia. The bone marrow biopsy showed hypocellular marrow. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old man was brought to the emergency room after his motorcycle slipped and he got several abrasive injuries. He complained of an excruciating burning sensation on the injured sites with minimal bleeding. Which of the following mechanism is most likely to reduce blood loss from his wounds?

The blood remains in circulation because of a balance between procoagulant and anticoagulant forces. Proteolytic destruction of which of the following by the protein C inhibits the process of coagulation?

answers.option: Activated factor I and factor IV
Activated factor VII and factor X
Activated factor X and factor XI
Activated factor V and factor VIII
Activated factor II and factor III

question: A 49-year-old bed-bound man feels shortness of breath and dies within a few minutes. Autopsy reveals a saddle embolus in the pulmonary artery. Which of the following events could likely have been his cause of death?

A 62-year-old woman is diagnosed with breast cancer, which has metastasized to lymph nodes. Cancer cells often acquire growth autonomy because of mutation in genes that encode components of signaling pathways downstream of growth factor receptors. Which of the following is an important component of oncoproteins in the category of signaling molecules?

A lecturer was teaching his student a very simple form of epidemiological study designs. He explained this type of study is based on a unique condition or rare disease reported by a consultant in a patient. Which of the following study designs is the lecturer referring to?

A 15-year-old patient is diagnosed with a connective tissue disorder. The disorder involves a protein called fibrillin, encoded by the FBN1 gene that maps to chromosomal locus 15q21. Mutations in the FBN1 gene are found in all patients suffering from which of the following diseases?

A 30-year-old man is brought to the emergency room with a complaint of severe chest pain for the past hour. He is diagnosed with unstable angina secondary to familial hypercholesterolemia. Familial hypercholesterolemia is an autosomal dominant disorder. If an affected person marries an unaffected person, what are the chances of the offspring developing the disorder?
Which of the following conditions is not an example of shock associated with systemic inflammation?

A 45-year-old woman develops swelling in her lower legs and feet after standing for long periods at the end of her 8-hour shift with no associated pain or erythema. There is no swelling at the beginning of her day. Her kidney and liver are also in healthy condition. What is the probable diagnosis for her condition?

answers.option: Increased hydrostatic pressure due to heart failure

question: A 55-year-old man presents to the outpatient department with stomach issues. On examination, he has massive splenomegaly seen (crossing the umbilicus). Which of the following conditions is he most likely to have?

Ultrasound confirms the presence of deep venous thrombosis. Which of the following is the most likely cause of her condition?

Which is not a cause of microcytic hypochromic anemia?
Which of the following is least likely to cause vitamin B12 deficiency?
An elderly man presents with chronic abdominal pain and an enlarged spleen. Which disease is most likely responsible for his symptoms?

A young female patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of bleeding and rashes on her body. On physical examination, she has petechiae on her body, and laboratory findings show low platelets with megakaryocytes. Prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thrombin time (aPTT) are in a normal range. Which of the following condition does she most likely have?

An 18-year-old complains of fatigue and shortness of breath. Her mean corpuscular volume (MCV) is 60 femtolitre and her mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) is 22 picogram. Which of the following is true for the morphology of her red blood cells?
Which plasma protein is commonly measured to indicate infection or inflammation?
Which disease occurs when the hydrophilic amino acid glutamic acid is replaced by the hydrophobic amino acid valine at position 6 in the globin chain?
Which chromosome is affected in β-thalassemia?
Which of the following is the genetic inheritance of hemophilia A?

answers.option: It is not a genetic disorder

question: Which of the following represents the clinicopathological representation of Arthus reaction?
Leucocytes reach the inflamed tissue by which of the following process?
Which of the following is a type II hypersensitivity reaction?

A 65-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with complaints of cough and fever. He was diagnosed with acute respiratory infection/inflammation. On a complete blood picture (CBC) test, which of the following leukocyte will be most abundant?
In which of the following conditions does iron undergo oxidation from ferrous to the ferric form in hemoglobin?
In which location does a saddle embolus usually lodge?

answers.option: At the bifurcation of the pulmonary artery

question: A 44-year-old man is treated with high doses of rabbit anti-thymocyte globulin for bone marrow failure. He develops fever, lymphadenopathy, arthralgias, and erythema of the hands and feet arise ten days later. Which of the following is the most probable explanation for these signs and symptoms?

answers.option: Cytokine secretion by natural killer cells

question: A 20-year-old lady visits the doctor, after five years of significant menstrual bleeding. She complains of easy bruising and states that bleeding from a tiny finger cut lasts longer than normal. Lab results show a hemoglobin of 10.5g/dL, and a platelet count of 275,000/mm^3, with normal platelet aggregation. Prothrombin time is 10.5 seconds (INR = 1.0) and аctivated partial thromboplastin time is 28 sec. Pap smear shows no abnormalities. Which of the following hematologic disorders is the most likely cause of this patient's menorrhagia?

A 65-year-old woman arrives at the orthopedic department with joint pain. Her doctor diagnoses her with osteoarthritis and osteoporosis. She is prescribed NSAIDs, calcium, and vitamin D. She returns after six months on the same medication, pale and short of breath. Her MCV is 73 fL and her hemoglobin was 9 g/dL. What could be the cause of low hemoglobin?

A 24-year-old Indian male arrives at the emergency room with severe chest and back pain that started three hours earlier while he was ascending a mountain and was short of breath. He states that he experienced identical symptoms several years earlier. Lab tests show that hemoglobin is 10 g/dL, total leukocyte count is 12,000/mm3, MCV is 87 fL, and reticulocytes are 25%. What could be his diagnosis?

A manufacturing company worker who looks sick, feverish, and tired, complains of bleeding from the nose and gums. The laboratory findings show that the patient has low levels of hemoglobin, white blood cells, and platelets, as well as a low reticulocyte count and a mean corpuscular volume of 88 fL. What could be the potential diagnosis?

A 27-year-old Ethiopian male presents to the outpatient department with breathlessness. He has a high heart rate and pale oral mucosa and conjunctiva. His initial blood tests showed 7.8 g/dL hemoglobin and 65 fL MCV. The doctor advises iron studies, which are normal. What could be the diagnosis?
When interpreting an iron profile, which of the following parameters is the most reliable indicator of iron deficiency?
What is the most characteristic feature of granulation tissue?

answers.option: Growth of fibroblasts and new capillaries

question: A 25-year-old male patient visited the outpatient department with complaints of shortness of breath at rest. His chest is normal on auscultation and there are no visible signs of lung disease on X-ray. He has low hemoglobin and an MCV of 105 fL based on his blood tests. Multisegmented neutrophils are not seen on blood smear. What could be the cause of his anemia?

A 52-year-old man noted a darkly pigmented "mole" on the back of his hand. During the past month, the lesion has gradually enlarged and bled spontaneously. On examination, there is a slightly raised, darkly pigmented, 1.2 cm lesion on the dorsum of the right hand. The lesion is completely excised. Microscopically, malignant melanoma is diagnosed. Which of the following factors is associated with the greatest risk for the development of this neoplasm?

A 41-year-old man comes into the medical outpatient department with complaints of weight loss, nausea, and vomiting for 5 months. He works at a factory that produces plastic pipes. On physical examination, he has tenderness to palpation in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen with hepatomegaly. An abdominal CT scan shows a 12 cm mass in the right lobe of the liver. A liver biopsy is performed, and a microscopic examination shows an angiosarcoma. The patient has most likely been exposed to which of the following agents?

An 18-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a palpable mass on the right side of his neck for 6 months. On physical examination, there is a 2 cm, firm, non-tender nodule involving the right lobe of the thyroid gland. Biopsy specimens of the nodule showed features consistent with carcinoma of the thyroid. No positive family history was found. Which of the following is relevant in the woman's past medical history?

A 58-year-old woman experienced an increased feeling of fullness in the neck for the past 3 months and noted a 3 kg weight loss during that time. On physical examination, there is a firm, fixed mass in a 3 × 5 cm area on the right side of the neck. A biopsy of the mass is performed. All areas of the tumor have similar morphology. Which of the following terms best describes this neoplasm?
Malignant neoplasms can be categorized as carcinomas and sarcomas. Which of the following statements describes carcinoma?

answers.option: Arising exclusively from the cells of ectodermal origin
Arising exclusively from the cells of endodermal origin
Arising exclusively from the cells of mesodermal origin
Arising from sheets of solid mesenchyme

question: A 26-year-old woman has a lump in her left breast. On physical examination, the physician finds an irregular, firm, 2 cm mass in the upper inner quadrant of the breast. A fine-needle aspirate of the mass shows carcinoma. The patient's 30-year-old sister was recently diagnosed with ovarian cancer, and 3 years ago her maternal aunt was diagnosed with ductal carcinoma of the breast and had a mastectomy. Which of the following genes is most likely to have undergone mutation to produce these findings

A first-year medical student develops pneumonia and is in the hospital for a week. Two weeks after hospital discharge, he develops a fever and begins coughing up thick, whitish, foul-smelling sputum. Computed tomography (CT) scan chest shows a localized collection of thick fluid in the lung. How would you best describe the outcome of acute inflammation in this patient?
What term best describes the type of inflammation in a 4-year-old child with redness and blister formation on the hands after accidental contact with boiling water?
Which statement best describes autosomal dominant disorders?
An affected male does not transmit the disorder to his sons, but all daughters are carriers. Which pattern of inheritance corresponds to the above statement?
Which cell type is most likely to be increased in a first year medical student experiencing excessive sneezing and watering of the eyes every year during spring and summer?

A 34-year-old man complains of epigastric pain. Endoscopy reveals a shallow sharply demarcated ulcer in the gastric antrum. Biopsy findings include lymphocyte, macrophage, and plasma cell infiltration, along with granulation tissue formation and fibrosis. What term best describes the type of inflammation observed in this man?
What does the membrane attack complex (MAC) formed during complement activation consist of?

answers.option: C5b, C6, C7, C8, and C9

question: What initiates the classical pathway of complement activation?

answers.option: Binding of mannose-binding lectin (MBL) to microbial surfaces
Binding of C-reactive protein (CRP) to microbial surfaces

question: Which of the following is correct regarding the inflammation in a 65-year-old man with a 5-year history of osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Cytokines and growth factors having no role in this type of inflammation
Neutrophilic exudate with pus formation on biopsy
Alternatively activated macrophages promoting tissue repair
Granuloma formation as a constant feature in these patients
Plasma cells and B lymphocytes being almost never found

question: Complement deficiencies lead to an increased risk of which of the following?
What is the involvement of the major histocompatibility complex (MHC)?
What does sterilization refer to?

answers.option: Killing or removing all forms of microbial life
Removing visible dirt from a surface
Reducing the number of microorganisms to a safe level

question: What is the most resistant form of microbial life to physical and chemical agents?

A 19-year-old woman came into the medical outpatient department with a history of frequent nosebleeds and increased menstrual flow. On physical examination, petechiae and purpura are present on the skin of her extremities. Laboratory studies show normal partial thromboplastin time (APTT), prothrombin time (PT), platelet count, and decreased von Willebrand factor activity. This patient most likely has a derangement in which of the following steps in hemostasis?

A 23-year-old pregnant woman has macrocytic anemia, an increased serum concentration of transferrin, and a normal serum concentration of vitamin B12. The most likely cause of her anemia is a deficiency of which of the following?
Hemostasis is the natural process that stops blood loss when an injury occurs. Which of the following bleeding manifestations or associations suggests secondary hemostatic disorder?

A 62-year-old woman complains of fatigue and numbness in her arms and legs for 1 month and takes thyroid replacement therapy for hypothyroidism. She has a long history of diarrhea on and off. A complete blood count (CBC) shows white blood cells (WBC) 3.8x10^9/L (normal: 4.0 to 11 x 10^9/L), hemoglobin (Hb) 8g/dL (normal: 12 to 16g/dL), hematocrit (Hct) 27 percent (normal: 36 to 46 percent), mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 120 fL (normal: 80 to 100fL), and platelets 115x109/L (normal: 150 to 400x10^9/L). She is diagnosed as a case of megaloblastic anemia with vitamin B12 deficiency. Which of the following autoantibodies is most likely present in this patient?
Which of the following is a characteristic of megaloblastic anemia?

answers.option: Serum vitamin B12 will be increased

question: Antibody-mediated hypersensitivity primarily occurs where?

answers.option: On the cell surface and in the matrix

question: Fat embolism typically manifests within how many days?
Which characteristic is indicative of a benign tumor?
Which complement protein is commonly used to diagnose complement system disorders?
What is a potential consequence of ileectomy?
What is the tumor that arises from all three germ layers?
Which of the following final product of the classical complement pathway?
An embolus can cause which of the following conditions?
When cells undergo injury, they may enter a state of quiescence or apoptosis. Which gene drives all these processes?
Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis is an example of which type of hypersensitivity?

A woman, with a history of two miscarriages, presents with hemorrhagic ischemia in the head and a false positive syphilis test. Laboratory studies show normal platelet count and increased partial thromboplastin time (aPTT). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
In dengue, the levels of which of the following are affected the most?
How many gene copies of the alpha chain of hemoglobin exist?

A 30-year-old patient presents with shortness of breath and bilateral lung opacities. There is no significant medical history, but the patient has a recent history of a femur fracture. What is the most likely diagnosis?
At what age range are the maximum levels of agglutinins typically observed?
Which of the following factors is deficient in classic hemophilia?
The peripheral smear of an anemic patient shows a normocytic normochromic picture. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the anemia?
During antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC), antibody-coated cells bind to receptors on which of the following cells?
Which of the following is a risk factor for atherosclerosis?

Hemostasis occurs by the following crucial steps: Vasoconstriction, primary hemostasis, secondary hemostasis, and activation of the fibrinolytic system. Which symptom is associated with secondary hemostasis disorders?
By which mechanism do cytotoxic T-cells kill infected cells?
What defines sickle cell anemia the best:

answers.option: It is because of point mutation in beta chain
It is the result of mutation in either alpha or beta chain
It is caused by deletion in the beta chain

question: Which MHC class is primarily responsible for presenting antigens to cytotoxic (CD8+) T-cells?

A 45-year-old female presents to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain. She has a history of heavy menstrual bleeding and painful periods. On examination, diffuse tenderness with guarding is noted. Her blood pressure is 100/60 mmHg, and her heart rate is 110 beats per minute. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which characteristic is more indicative of malignant tumors as compared to benign tumors?
What disease is characterized by high serum iron, low TIBC, and high ferritin levels?
Which of the following statements regarding cell proliferation and gene regulation is true?

answers.option: Cell cycle is proliferated by CDK inhibitors
Cell cycle is arrested by p53
Rb is called the guardian of the genome
Severely damaged cells or dying cells are called quiescent

question: A 45-year-old woman presents with joint pain, fever, and a facial rash, and describes the underlying pathophysiology of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). Which of the following best describes the mechanism of SLE?

answers.option: Direct antibody binding to cellular antigens
Immune complex deposition and complement activation

question: Which of the following types of malignant tumor is mesenchymal in origin?
Which of the following is an autosomal recessive disease?
A 25-year-old woman develops urticaria and difficulty breathing after eating peanuts. Which of the following mechanisms is primarily responsible for her symptoms?
Which of the following is the gold standard test for the lab diagnosis of malaria?
A 2-year-old girl gets her ears pierced. The scar tissue extends outside the boundary of the piercing. What is this type of scar called?
What are the main components of granulation tissue?

answers.option: Endothelial cells and smooth muscle cells

question: A woman presents to the outpatient department with cervical warts. She has a history of multiple sexual partners. What is the virus most likely responsible for causing cervical cancer?
A person with hookworm infection presents with anemia. What kind of nutritional deficiency will be seen in such a person?
A student while cutting onions accidentally cuts her finger superficially. However, the blood does not stop oozing. She goes to the emergency department. What may be the underlying pathology?
A 35-year-old man, with an enlarged cervical lymph node, had an excision biopsy which revealed epithelioid cells and multinucleated giant cells in his lymph node. What type of inflammation is this?
Which is the most effective method for sterilizing instruments to free them from all microbial life including bacterial endospores?
What is the primary pathology caused by the plasmodium of malaria?

answers.option: Lymph nodes infection leads to lymphadenopathy
Red cell destruction leads to anemia

question: African Americans are at a higher risk of:
Why does an Rh-negative mother experience no or only mild effects during her first pregnancy with an Rh-positive baby in cases of erythroblastosis fetalis?

answers.option: Fetal liver doesn't produce Rh antigen until the third trimester
Rh-positive fetal blood is not exposed to the maternal immune system until labor
The titer of IgG antibodies is much less
The anemia due to hemolysis is compensated by fetal erythropoiesis

question: A 45-year-old male presents to the emergency room after sustaining multiple fractures in a motor vehicle accident. He undergoes emergency treatment, including stabilization and splinting of the fractures. However, a few hours after treatment, he develops sudden shortness of breath and is found to have pulmonary edema on chest X-ray. What is the most likely cause of these symptoms?
Why does Rh incompatibility typically result in mild or no consequences during the first pregnancy in an Rh-negative mother who has been sensitized by the Rh antigen?

answers.option: The fetus naturally lacks Rh antigens until second trimester
The fetal liver does not produce Rh antigens until after birth
Low IgG titer during primary immune response
Massive fetal hemolysis is compensated by increased erythropoiesis
Antibodies are unable to cross the placenta
